definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
abbr. for Sichuan Province 四川[Si4 chuan1] in southwest China
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: They are typical geological remains from the Glacial Age.
sentences.chinese: 是典型的冰川期地質遺蹟。

sentences.english: What they found is that during the ice ages , the amount of water in the oceans decreased.
sentences.chinese: 他們的發現是在冰川期，海洋裏的水量是減少的。

sentences.english: Most of the Ice Age spans a period of time for which no element has an appropriate decay rate.
sentences.chinese: 冰川期的大部分期間都找不到具有合適衰變率的元素。

sentences.english: The term "Ice Age" may give a wrong impression.
sentences.chinese: “冰川期”這個術語可能會讓人產生錯誤的印象。

sentences.english: There is no reliable way of dating much of the Ice Age.
sentences.chinese: 沒有任何可靠的方法來斷定大部分冰川期的地質年代。

sentences.english: He saved like a lunatic squirrel for a new ice age .
sentences.chinese: 他很象一隻爲防備新冰川期來臨而積攢糧食的松鼠。

sentences.english: If it wasn't for snowball Earth we may not be here today.
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有冰川期的地球我們可能出現在今天。

definition: Holocene (geological period covering approx 12000 years since the last ice age)
fourth period/quaternary (geological period covering the recent ice ages over the last 180,000 years)
third period/tertiary (geological era since the extinction of the dinosaurs at the Cretaceous-Tertiary boundary 65 million years ago)
Pleistocene (geological epoch from 2m years ago, covering the most recent ice ages)
